marketNews.title: Election Projected to be Single Round, IHSG Strong
marketNews.content:
Presidential and vice‑presidential candidate pair Prabowo Subianto and Gibran Rakabuming Raka obtained 56‑59% of the vote in the 2024 election according to quick count results from several survey agencies. Meanwhile, the KPU real count on Thursday (15/2) showed that they received 56.32% of the 43.93% of votes that had been entered.

Although the calculations are still provisional, the large margin indicates that the election will likely be concluded in a single round. The result was welcomed positively by market participants and foreign investors, with the Jakarta Composite Index (IHSG) rising +1.3% to 7,303 on Thursday (15/2), where 10 of 11 sectors strengthened.

Based on the provisional quick count from Litbang Kompas on Thursday (15/2), several parties that are part of the coalition supporting Prabowo‑Gibran received more than 4% of the vote and are projected to enter parliament. Those parties are Golkar (14.47%), Gerindra (13.58%), Demokrat (7.59%) and PAN (7.1%). Their combined vote share is only 42.74% and does not reach 50%.

PDI‑P – the party backing the Ganjar‑Mahfud ticket – obtained the largest legislative vote share with 16.97%, according to the Litbang Kompas quick count. PDI‑P is the only party supporting Ganjar‑Mahfud that received more than 4%. Meanwhile, the three parties supporting Anies‑Muhaimin each received more than 4%: PKB 11.29%, Nasdem 9.42% and PKS 8.36%.

Key Takeaway

Sectors and stocks that could benefit from the presidential election result are:
- Sectors linked to Prabowo‑Gibran program plans:
  - Free milk program: ULTJ, CMRY
  - Continuation of the new capital city (IKN) project: PTPP, ADHI, ACST, PANI, PWON
  - Continuation of downstream processing: ANTM, INCO, NCKL
- Big banks that receive foreign inflows: BBCA, BBRI, BMRI, BBNI. Note that these stocks already have significant foreign capital and are not cheap.
- Stocks whose shareholders are perceived by the market to have affiliations with the Prabowo‑Gibran coalition: ADRO, ADMR, MDKA, MBMA, TRIM, ABBA, MARI.

Although the market appears enthusiastic about the provisional results, it is important to remember that the positive sentiment may not last long. Investors should continue to monitor fundamentals and valuations of each company.

Furthermore, the effectiveness of the new government's decision‑making in implementing its programs will depend on the coalition's ability to attract other parties in the DPR, given that the coalition's vote share is still below 50%.

Related stocks: PTPP, ADHI, ACST, PANI, PWON, ANTM, INCO, NCKL, ULTJ, CMRY.

marketNews.title: BJTM Distributes Dividend with Yield 7.9%
marketNews.content:
BJTM: Bank Pembangunan Daerah Jawa Timur will distribute the 2023 fiscal year dividend amounting to IDR 816.69 billion, or IDR 54.39 per share. The cumulative dividend on the regular and negotiated markets is payable on 20 February 2024, with payment on 7 March 2024. Based on BJTM's closing price on Thursday (15/2) at IDR 690 per share, the implied dividend yield is 7.9%.

GGRM: Gudang Garam has established a toll road company named PT Surya Sapta Agung Tol (SSAT) to build the Kediri‑Tulungagung toll project. The company was founded together with the controlling shareholder PT Suryaduta Investama, with fully paid‑in capital of IDR 2 trillion. GGRM's ownership in SSAT is 99.9%.

GOTO: GoTo Gojek Tokopedia management told the IDX that the company cannot comment on rumors about a merger with Grab Holdings Ltd. (Nasdaq: GRAB), as reported by Bloomberg last week. Management also stated that there are currently no discussions on the matter.

CCSI: Communication Cable Systems Indonesia plans a rights issue of up to 163.6 million new shares (13.6%) with a dilution effect of up to 12%. The issue price and ratio have not been announced; the proceeds will be used for working capital. The plan will be discussed at the extraordinary shareholders meeting on 22 March 2024.

FAPA: The controlling shareholder of FAP Agri, Prinsep Management Limited, sold 18.9 million FAPA shares at IDR 5,300 per share on 26 January and 5 February 2024. The total transaction value reached IDR 100.2 billion. After the transaction, Prinsep Management Limited's ownership in FAPA decreased from 75.79% to 75.27%.

Additional market updates:
- Indonesia recorded inflation of 3.1% YoY in January 2024 (vs. Dec 2023: 3.4% YoY), above the consensus of 2.9% YoY. Monthly inflation was 0.3% MoM (vs. Dec 2023: 0.2% MoM), above the consensus of 0.2% MoM. Core inflation in January 2024 was 3.9% YoY, unchanged from Dec 2023 but higher than the consensus of 3.7% YoY.
- BPS reported that Indonesia's trade surplus in January 2024 fell to USD 2.02 billion (vs. Jan 2023: USD 3.88 billion), lower than the consensus forecast of USD 2.99 billion. This is the smallest surplus since July 2023. Exports declined 8.06% YoY to USD 20.52 billion, the lowest level in eight months. Imports rose 0.36% YoY to USD 18.51 billion.
- Japan officially entered recession after Q4‑23 GDP contracted 0.4% YoY (vs. Q3‑23: -3.3% YoY), far below the consensus forecast of +1.4% YoY.
- Commodity analysis firm Kpler reported that coal imports to Asia fell 5% MoM in January 2024 to 77.65 million tonnes, driven by weaker demand from China and India, the two largest coal importers.
- Bitcoin price broke the USD 50,000 level on Tuesday (13/2) for the first time since December 2021. Since the start of the year, Bitcoin has risen more than 17% YTD, boosted by the US SEC's approval of a Bitcoin‑based exchange‑traded fund in January 2024.

tickerNews.title: GOTO Declines to Comment on Rumored Merger with Grab
tickerNews.content: GOTO: GoTo Gojek Tokopedia management told the IDX that the company cannot comment on rumors about a merger with Grab Holdings Ltd. (Nasdaq: GRAB), as reported by Bloomberg last week. Management also stated that there are currently no discussions on the matter.
